page.title: 07NEWSPAPER EXTRACTS.
page.content: { {CAERWYS CHRONICLE. {MARCH:-}On Sunday,17th February,the church clock stopped .... this was the first time in about 5 years,and probably only the second time that it has stopped since it was installed in 1913. {APRIL:-}Soon"A Host of Golden Daffodils"should adorn the highways and byways of our Town, if last Autumn's 'Plant a Daffodil'campaign was successful. 4 year old Carys Hughes, Park Grove,reports that bulbs she planted in"a secret place"are growing well.Indicative of the campaign's success may be the crocus and snowdrops blooming on local banks where previously none existed. {MAY:-}Sighted in Caerwys Garden-a male Black Red-Start.
